channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023100188
item.description:
Report E-2023100188

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one case of printing ink (in1210) damaging 6 of the inner poly one pint bottles and releasing 1 liter of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023090925
item.description:
Report X-2023090925

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-16
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was in unload when discovered wet, QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage, DescribePack: Closure came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles. DurationRel: 21 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090653
item.description:
Report X-2023090653

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-16
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090653 SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal paint can with no lid clips in corrugated carton. No hazard markings on exterior. All cans dented and lids opened, spilling contents and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. 2. X-2023090654 SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal paint can with no lid clips in corrugated carton. No hazard markings on exterior. All cans dented. Two lids opened and spilled contents, soiling other cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023090635
item.description:
Report X-2023090635

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload area of the building. After the damage was called out on the radio, an Admin promptly contained the spill and took the shipment back to the hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: The source of the leakage seems to be from the cap/closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was tipped upwards in accordance with the orientation arrows.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZMAT WAS PICKED UP, UPON UNLOADING TRUCK HAZMAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING FROM THE LID. HAZMAT PLACE IN TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA FOR HESS REPORT. DescribePack: LEAKING FROM UNDER LID, SEAL WASNT ON CORRECTLY AND BECAME LOOSE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT WAS PLACE IN TOTE, BROUGHT TO QA FOR PROCESSING.

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On the August 5,2023, on flight UA1951 IAD-SFO passenger Fuller/Gerald's laptop was getting hot during the flight. The laptop was transferred inside the thermal bag by the flight crew customer indicated it was a re-furbished MacBook Battery appreared to vent and was placed in a Thermal Containment bag 1
